title: Magic System Rules Sheet
description: Implements Ellefson's Seven Laws for a magic system: what is possible/impossible, who can perform, types and interactions, failure consequences, legal status, consistency rules, and learning path.

law_1_possible_impossible.description: Law 1: What is possible and what is impossible due to the magic's physics

law_2_who_can_perform.description: Law 2: Who can perform this magic and how common they are

law_3_types_and_interactions.description: Law 3: Types of magic and how they interact with each other

law_4_failure_consequences.description: Law 4: What happens when magic fails (nothing, accidental result, energy release, catastrophe)

law_5_legal_status.description: Law 5: Legal status of this magic by sovereign power

law_6_consistency_notes.description: Law 6: Notes on maintaining consistency -- follow your own rules

law_7_learning_path.description: Law 7: How magic is learned (training method, duration, progression)

sanderson_law_1.description: Sanderson's Law 1: Magic can solve conflict proportional to how well the audience understands it

sanderson_law_2.description: Sanderson's Law 2: Limitations are more interesting than powers

sanderson_law_3.description: Sanderson's Law 3: Expand what you already have before adding new magic

x-cross-references.magic-system-overview: This rules sheet belongs to a Magic System Overview
x-cross-references.sovereign-power-profile: Legal status varies by sovereign power
